document.masterDocTitle: A review of the genus Speocarcinus Stimpson, 1859 (Crustacea: Brachyura: Xanthidae), with a key to its species and the description of one new species

Type locality.
Gulf of Mexico , Texas, Sabine Pass.

Remarks .
Speocarcinus lobatus
was described in great detail by
Felder & Rabalais ( 1986 )
. It mostly resembles young
S. carolinensis
and for the distinction between these species see under
S. carolinensis
.

Distribution. Off Mississippi, Louisiana and Texas and the Gulf coast of Florida, between 6 and
65 m .
